p: The dominant group of identified volatiles was monoterpenes (70.88–95.91%). Their oxygenated derivatives were the most abundant (41.7–68.8%), among which 1,8-cineole and cis-pinocamphone were found in the highest contents. Only in the sample 4EO, the content of monoterpene hydrocarbons (43.53%) was higher than the content of oxygenated monoterpene derivatives. With regard to the monoterpene hydrocarbons, the dominant constituents were β-pinene and limonene. Methyl eugenol (up to 28.33%), the only compound belonging to the phenylpropanoid group, and sesquiterpene hydrocarbons (up to 0.87%) were present in a lower percentage. Monoterpene hydrocarbons, such as β-pinene, limonene, Z- β-ocimene, α-pinene, sabinene and the oxygenated monoterpene derivative myrtenal, were present in all the investigated samples.
